item.title: Example Presentation
item.description: 2020 Presidential Election in Swing States We are going to explore some of the pivotal swing states in the 2020 Presidential Election Michigan Here is a map of the 2020 Presidential election in Michigan by congressional district. Pennsylvania Here is a map of the 2020 Presidential election in Pennsylvania by congressional district (not actually: itâ€™s wrong). Wisconsin Here is a map of the 2020 Presidential election in Wisconsin by congressional district.

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.

item.title: A Plain Markdown Post
item.description: This sample post is mainly for blogdown users. If you do not use blogdown, you can skip the first section. 1. Markdown or R Markdown This is a post written in plain Markdown (*.md) instead of R Markdown (*.Rmd). The major differences are: You cannot run any R code in a plain Markdown document, whereas in an R Markdown document, you can embed R code chunks (```{r}); A plain Markdown post is rendered through Goldmark by default, and an R Markdown document is compiled by rmarkdown and Pandoc.
